item.title: The new prodigy behind Google translate
item.description: I read a lot of misconceptions this morning related to this article regarding Google Translate. Is not properly fresh news but this morning in my telegram group @scienza, this other popularization article has been posted that completely misunderstood the premises of the original academic article (also the so-called informed comments are not really , so I decided to try to keep the record straight and offer a question. In the article the approach is referred as a multitasking learning framework

item.title: The Practice of Programming
item.description:
I started reading “The Practice of Programming” by Kernigan and Pike.

The book hinges on the concepts of simplicity, clarity and generality as foundation of a good code. Eventually automation can bring something to the table generating code from algorithms.

It starts by the usual “obvious” remarks about style:
